subtitle: Ghana country page
description: How malaria is affecting the people of Ghana
title: Malaria in your country
content:
Malaria is a dangerous threat in Ghana, so it is important to take precautions and protect yourself and your family from the disease.  Here is how malaria affected Ghana in 2012:

 - **100% of the population of Ghana was living in an at-risk area** where the malaria parasite was present.  

 - It is estimated that **6,900,000 people caught the disease**, and **17,000 died**, just from a simple mosquito bite. 

 - Malaria also cost the economy of Ghana **5,700,000,000 Cedi** in lost productivity and treatment costs.



**How you can help**

It doesn’t have to be this way.  You can help protect your family, and your country, from malaria by taking a few simple steps:

 - Make sure your whole family sleeps under a bed net every night.

 - Seek testing, and then treatment, from a doctor or health worker at the first sign of illness.

 - If you are given treatment, make sure to finish your pills!
 
To learn more about malaria in your county, visit the [country name] malaria program.
